firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to store conversations and messages related to the AI Business Analyst application. It follows a hierarchical structure to represent the relationships between users, conversations, and messages. Each level incorporates design principles to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging.

Specifically, authorization independence is achieved through path-based ownership.  A user can only access conversations and messages under their user ID path. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules to check parent document attributes.

QAPs (Rules are not filters) is addressed by Structural Segregation - User drafts are kept in a separate collection from global conversations, requiring different security postures. This segregation ensures secure list operations.

The chosen structure also supports invariants such as ownership by employing hierarchical paths.
